page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: This is an area of farming land mainly laid down to pasture. Most of the farms are between 100 and 200 acres in size rearing herds of cows for their milk. The fields are bounded by Devon style earth banks with hedges running along the top. Here and their are small woodland copses. There is one settlement, Peters Marland, with church, a special school, village hall and a number of houses. The population of Marland parish is approximately 200. All roads are minor and narrow. Milk is collected by bulk tanker and taken to the Dairy at Torrington. Children for the most part attend sachool in Merton, Shebbear or (after the age of 11) in Torrington.
